SEARCH
Package CustomLibrary

Class CustomArray

java.lang.Object
CustomLibrary.CustomArray
public class CustomArray extends Object
Contains utility functions that display and operate on integer arrays, no specific hash function algorithms

  • Constructor Summary

  • Method Details

    • isLatin

      public static boolean isLatin(int[][] in)
      Checks a 2D int array for Latin-ness, each row and column contains exactly one of each value. Used to help verify the integerity of the multiplication tables generated
      Parameters:
      in - 2D int array
      Returns:
      boolean true if in[][] is Latin and false if not

    • plusArrayDisplay

      public static void plusArrayDisplay(int[][] in, boolean noZeros, boolean noSpaces)
      displays a 2D integer array
      Parameters:
      in - 2D integer array to display
      noZeros - true if you want to replace zeros with spaces on output
      noSpaces - true if you don't want any spaces between elements

    • plusArrayDisplay

      public static void plusArrayDisplay(int[][] in, boolean noZeros, boolean noSpaces, String label)
      displays a 2D integer array
      Parameters:
      in - 2D integer array to display
      noZeros - true if you want to replace zeros with spaces on output
      noSpaces - true if you don't want space padding on output
      label - array title

    • layersDisplay

      public static void layersDisplay(int[][][] in, boolean noZeros, boolean noSpaces, String label)
      displays a 2D integer array
      Parameters:
      in - 2D integer array to display
      noZeros - true if you want to replace zeros with spaces on output
      noSpaces - true if you don't want space padding on output
      label - array title

    • plusPlusArrayDisplay

      public static void plusPlusArrayDisplay(int[][] in, boolean noZeros, boolean noSpaces, int rowDiv, int colDiv)
      displays a 2D integer array on the console
      Parameters:
      in - 2D integer array to display
      noZeros - true if you want to replace zeros with spaces on output
      noSpaces - true if you don't want space padding on output
      rowDiv - number of rows used on increment
      colDiv - number of columns used on increment

    • basicArrayDisplay

      public static void basicArrayDisplay(int[][] in)
      displays a 2D integer array
      Parameters:
      in - 2D integer array to display

    • layerOf

      public static int[][] layerOf(int[][] in, int layer, int base, int modN)
      A particular place value's layer of an input array
      Parameters:
      in - 2D grid
      layer - which place value
      base - which base
      modN - which mod
      Returns:
      input with parameters applied

    • reflectRotateTranspose

      public int[][] reflectRotateTranspose(int[][] in, int rotation)
      Reflects and transposes square integer arrays
      Parameters:
      in - square integer array
      rotation - an integer 0-8, the one's place is reflecting across the y axis, the two's place is reflecting across the x-axis, and the four's place is the transpose. 0 would be do nothing and 7 would be all 3
      Returns:
      transformed input array

    • flatten

      public int[] flatten(int[][] in)
      Takes in a 2D array and changes it into a 1D array
      Parameters:
      in - 2D integer array
      Returns:
      flattened input
